headline: Deviled Eggs I
description: Deviled eggs are a classic for good reason! This easy recipe keeps up the tasty tradition.

video.description: Watch how to make these classic deviled eggs
video.name: Deviled Eggs I

name: Deviled Eggs I

recipeInstructions.text: Place eggs in a pot of salted water. Bring the water to a boil, and let eggs cook in boiling water until they are hard boiled, approximately 10 to 15 minutes. Drain eggs, and let cool.
Cut eggs in half, lengthwise. Remove the egg yolks and mash them together in a small mixing bowl. Mix in the paprika, mayonnaise, and dry mustard. Spoon mixture into the egg whites; cool and serve.

review.reviewBody: Perfect deviled eggs!
I added I, T, more of mayonnaise and added paprika on top but overall it was good
I substituted Swiss cheese for Colby cheese. Great recipe. Super easy
No changes, perfect the way they are!

With prepared mustard, pinch of salt, paprika sprinkled on top, A+.

Mixing the paprika in, tastes same, but it is pink.

Tangy and tasteful
Definitely a recipe to repeat
I wish there were changes if you made more eggs
Awful taste! I followed exact and it has a bad after taste!!!!
Used smoked paprika...yum!
Terrible- no flavor
These were OK, but on the bland side. I added 1/4 t. Himalayan sea salt and a teaspoon of dill leaves, and sprinkled paprika over the eggs instead of mixing it in.
This is for anyone who did a review without using the dry mustard don't write a review and learn to cook because the main reason for the recipe is dry mustard!

Great basic recipe, I use a blend of honey mustard and Dijon mustard with a splash of cider vinegar and milk for creaminess. I also top with fresh chopped parsley and paprika. Every thing else in recipe is pretty much the same.
Best recipe ever!!!
These were very good, but they needed salt.
And a 1 TAB vinegar or to taste makes it much better for the eggs.

Everyone loves this recipe. I do add diced yellow onion and sweet relish to my recipe. I mix in the paprika and sprinkle just a bit on top for colour. I use my cake decorating utensils to pipe it into the eggs to make them look more festive! This is a definite hit with my family and friends!

I made this for this and last thanksgiving, it was soo good. I've never had deviled eggs before last thanksgiving, but these were great and easy. Everyone at home loved them. I will continue to make them like this.
Easy quick and yummy

As with others I found this a good BASIC recipe.
I use salad dressing (Miracle Whip) instead of mayo. It gives it that extra tang without adding vinegar, and also a teaspoon of finely grated onion and a dash of Worcestershire sauce. I have used this recipe (with my additions) for more than 40 years and have never had a single leftover.
Really easy to make. Didn't take that long. But while making the eggs, I added a little more of the mayo and mustard because the yolks were a little bit too dry.

I had never made deviled eggs before, so I wanted a simple recipe. This tasted great! I ended up putting a little more mayo and using regular mustard as others have suggested. I also put in about 6 shakes of garlic salt and sprinkled the paprika on top of the mixture. I had melon ball scoops to fill the eggs and that worked well. I'll try using vinegar to help with the creaminess next time.
I added some relish to my deviled eggs, and it added a little more deliciousness
Great, simple recipe!
Great recipe! I also used prepared mustard and topped the eggs with little slices of sweet pickles which was a huge hit. I can never make enough eggs for the family!!
Quick and easy to make!
Too dry! They had good flavor, but I had to add more mayo. Should have used prepared mustard instead of the mustard powder. Made them a little too mustardy!
This recipe is a bit dry and bland. We'll still eat all of them, but I might find a different recipe next time. There's always the chance I screwed up the recipe, but that seems hard.

These remind me of my mom's growing up. Made a batch of these awhile back and loved them. My husband didn't care for them but I thought they were delicious (next time I may need to add a little bit of salt.)
Great!! A simple and original recipe, just like momma used to make!
i thought these deviled eggs were so delicious!but instead of mustard powder i used actuall mustartd. it tasted so good! i will definitly make them for thanksgiving. ~turtles

Has a lot of potential, On its own, this recipe would probably just be decent, but I'm still giving it 3 stars because it's an excellent recipe that anyone can easily tweak to their own liking. Good basic recipe, but it can be made even better with some of the additions suggested by other raters:
Really great eggs. Went off another review and added 1T of pickle juice, then topped the eggs with a little sprinkle of cayenne at the end. At a picnic, these eggs were gone in a flash.
I added a few more spoonfulls of mayo, and about a tsp of sweet relish to it. These were VERY good!
was quick and simple
I add pickle juice and lessen the mayonnaise. It makes it moist and have more of a bite.

Excellent. I used Miracle Whip since that's all I usually have on hand and these are just like my mom used to make them. I did add a bit of extra miracle whip and used prepared mustard. I only sprinkled paprika over top with some parsley flakes, didn't add to the yolk mixture.
Great basic recipe, added pickle juice and everyone ate them super fast and love them! Thanks.
Yumm! Loved them!
The egg yolk portion seemed rather dry, even with a little extra mayo.
Added a tsp of white vinegar and it was perfect! YUM!

Question, as per instructions. How much salt should be placed in water? How much water? Are the eggs to boil for 10 to 15 minutes or is the water cold when you start and then bring to a boil? Total time 10 to 15 minutes. Do I shell the eggs or cut the eggs with the shells on? One more thing as per recipes instructions say to place mixture back into the SHELL of the egg! I have tryed I can't cut the egg shell in half without destroying it and the thought of eating the shell is not very pleasant.
These were great! This was my first time making them. I made them for a small gathering that my husband and I had at our house, and they went so fast!!! Very simple and quick. Thanks for sharing!!
the disappeared in record time

I did not care for this. This is WAY too much paprika, and it shouldn't go INTO the yolk mixture! It turned it an awful color and makes it taste like paprika, which is supposed to be a GARNISH--not a flavor. The mixture was also way too dry.
This brings back memory when my aunt made devils eggs. my son love them.
Like another contributor, I add a dash of vinegar and yellow mustard. It gives it a little zing.

These are the exact ingredients I use in my deviled eggs. I use a little more mayo then listed, however I also boil at least twice the amount of eggs for a party. And, then I sprinkle the paprika on top for color with a very light dusting on each egg. It is not an actual measurement. I do not put any in the actual mashed yolks though. The ingredients really are simple, but this is the classic method in my opinion. I would just adjust all the ingredients to taste. Deviled eggs are not an exact science. And, a little salt wouldn't hurt.
Loved this. I used to make these a long time ago but couldn't remember what went in them.
Made these as is. Everyone loved them. I thought they were a little on the dry side but that is just personal preference.
Really good recipe. I made a couple of changes. I used yellow prepared mustard, added a small amount of white vinegar, & about a tbs. of dill relish.

This is a classic, no-frills deviled egg recipe, which was exactly what I was looking for. They turned out beautifully, and there's plenty of room for additions/experimentation. I just added a touch of garlic salt.
loved at the office pot luck!
i just read someone commenting on how it tasted like too much worcestershire, but there isn't any in it. i loved them.i also like worcestershire. yummy.

I just made this and its great! I would make changes like a few others suggested about using real mustard and sprinkling the paprika on top! ALSO: If you know nothing about eggs...if you buy your eggs and wait a week and then make this...your eggs peel much easier!!
These turned out awesome and didnt last but a minute. Will make these again.

i totally changed this which people hate i know but i used yellow mustard and i needed a tbls. more mayo and i added minced onion and sweet pickle relish. these were good. im giving it 5 stars because it made me want deviled eggs they were good and i changed it.
This recipe reminds of the devil eggs I used to make for my kids years ago and I lost the recipe. I will definately make these again.
Great, delicious easy recipe for deviled eggs.
Worchestire taste was too strong.
Perfect, just like my grandmom's! Very easy to make. I didn't change a thing.
This is a great recipe, but someone once told me to put a half of a green olive on top to decorate, and I have never done it any other way! It makes the PERFECT Deviled Egg!
Very good.. But i did add more mayo and used regular mustard.
I would not make this recipe as written again. Color was not good. The mixture was way too dry so I added a lot more mayo. I didn't like these at all.
I have just recently started to add green onions (minced) in the the mix and a little to the top! It is very good, as well as some sweet relish in the mix.
This is the way my mom has always made her deviled eggs except she uses real mustard not the powdered kind. Very simple and tasty!
My family loves these eggs, a couple changes, I use prepared mustard, sprinkle the paprika and I add pickle juice, no set amount, just whatever passes the taste test :)
I made these eggs twice. The second time was to make sure I did it right! Try another recipe!!!

I was looking for a basic recipe that I could tweak and this is it! I found the best way to hard boil eggs (as another reviewer suggested) is to cover eggs with water and bring to a boil on high heat. Once the water is boiling, cover the eggs and turn the burner to simmer. Cook for 15 minutes. Generously adding salt to the water in the beginning makes them easier to peel. I used miracle whip, regular mustard, salt & pepper, and a dollop of sweet pickle relish. Also used paprika as a garnish rather than in the recipe.
Delicious!! I didn't add paprika to the mixture I just sprinkled on top for looks and I also used regular mustard.
Very good. They looked a little dry but tasted great. I did use yellow mustard rather than powder.
I tried this recipe, it was okay, needed alittle more spice to it.
awesome deviled eggs!
I needed to add more mayo and also needed salt.
Great basic recipe! I added a bit of sweet relish (just enough to give a hint of sweetness), a little more mayo, and sprinkled the paprika on top rather than mixing it in.
Pretty good, I added a few things of my own, such as dill weed to give it a zippy taste.

A very basic recipe. I'm not a big fan of mayo so I thought this recipe would appeal to me. I definitely would add at least an extra teaspoon of mayo.. the consistency just wasn't right. Otherwise.. a fine standard recipe that leaves a lot of room for you to be creative with.

These were really tasty, I'm pregnant and they really satisfied that craving. I did a few of my own tweaks -- I added a little bit more mayo than asked, I sprinkled paprika over them at the end instead of in the middle, put a dash of pepper and a splash of white vinegar as well. Topped it all off with a sliced olive..Came out great, I put the mixture in a ziploc back and cut the tip off and it was so easy to fill the halves. Definately a hit, will be making them again. My husband is not a fan of deviled eggs but he wolfed these down. Thanks for a great recipe!

This recipe as written is bland and the filling is too dry. My family loves deviled eggs and this recipe only got an average rating from them as well. Next time would try some of the additions from other viewers to give this basic recipe a little more moisture and flavor.
I think simple is best when making deviled eggs; however I did add salt and pepper.
Not the best in my opinion, I definitely prefer prepared mustard instead of Ground mustard.
Very tasty, very basic deviled egg recipe. Nothing spectacular, but nothing bad about it. Awesome for a beginner! Next time, I will jazz it up some.
Very simple but very good recipe. Used regular mustard instead of mustard powder. Always easier to put filling in ziploc/sandwich bag, snipping corner and using that to fill eggs.

I grew up on this recipe, my this is how my grandmother made deviled eggs, but she never wrote it down. I've been looking for it, but everything I have found up until now has all sorts of extra stuff in it, but this is how it should be done! Nice and simple, the way I like it.

This recipe wasn't bad. I used a mixture of light Mayo and miracle whip, which gave it a slight zing. I also used smoked paprika to (obviously)give it a nice smokey flavor, which I thought was tastey. Regarding the review above; the tint of the yolk mixture doesn't matter so much if you sprinkle more paprika over the eggs when finished, like the picture above.

This is a good basic egg recipe but boy do I wish I had read other reviews before making it. DO NOT put the paprika in with your egg yolk mash. The paprika turns the filling this weird orange color. It is VERY unattractive. I made them for a bridal shower and (whereas they taste fine) only about 3 or 4 of the eggs got eaten because of the appearance.

Followed other reviewers' suggestions and used prepared mustard and just sprinkled the eggs with paprika afterward. This was so easy and the eggs were gone the next day. The only thing I would do differently is add a pinch of salt to the yolk mixture.

I threw this recipe together while I was having a picnic. I used all the 'suggestions' including using ice water to cool them more quickly AND added the tsp of vinegar to give it a little "kick". They were a huge hit but the best suggestion was to put the filling in the sandwich bag and squeeze it into the halves...I know it seems simple but to a beginner like me, it saved me a HUGE mess! I also impressed my guests with such a great idea! Also, I didn't follow the instructions by measurement, I did all ingredients by taste. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because I personally like mine with a little spicy kick - I guess horseradish is where I would have gotten that but didn't have any on hand. They really did turn out terrific, made 36 deviled egg halves, all were devoured within 30 mins... I'd say they were a hit!
These were prety good, but I think I've had better.
Has anyone ever seen orange color filled deviled eggs? Neither have it. This recipe called for 1/2 teaspoon of paprika...ruined my deviled eggs for a party I have tomorrow.

Great basic recipe, and thanks for posting! I remember my first try at this. I used too much mustard and salt... So I cut it (literally) and added a bit of sweet pickle juice from gherkin jar and a dab of honey. People raved at the company potluck and all wanted recipe (even though there were 4 other deviled egg bringers). I wish I knew the exact measure of ingredients, but I just "winged it", LOL! I told them it was a family secret, hehe. Doubt I could ever reproduce the exact taste.
this were not very tasty, nobody liked them and i followed the recipe correctly.

i prepared this recipe the way "HARMONYRN" suggested in the review that they made of this recipe then added the paprika on top. the eggs were excellent that way. and i highly recommend them being prepared that way, cause the ingredients are usually staples in every household and it makes the filling nice and creamy.
Can't go wrong with deviled eggs. Very easy to make. I used dijon mustard instead but followed everything else.
These are great. I do caution however, I used hot smoked paprika and wow, what a kick! This is a keeper recipe. Thanks!

Tasty recipe. I used dijon mustard instead of the mustard powder. Mixing the paprika in with the yolks made it orange, though and it looked a little funny. I prefer dusting the top with paprika- it makes for a better presentation.

My fiance loved these. I dont care for them much, I like the egg whites by themselves but anything more I dont touch it. So I didnt try these but my fiance who is EXTREAMLY hard to please when it comes to cooking for said they were quote on quote "EXELLENT!" Didnt even have to ask. Thats rare. I dont think he's ever told me that so they must have been. I added a little extra mayo, looked kinda dry and took the advice of reviewers and used prepared mustard (store brand, couldnt even tell) instead of Powdered. Also didnt measure paprika, just shook a little on each egg by sight.

this recipe is so good! just about the way i make mine. i use prepared mustard, and a little more mayo, and i find if i mash the eggs while they're still warm-ish, they come out much smoother. 1/2 of my family likes sweet relish, the other hates it...lol. so, i make both. on the ones without relish, i put slices of black olives. on the ones with, i put sliced green olives (w/ pimentos) on top. it looks fancy and tastes really good! i always put a bowl of both olives on the side. thanks for posting this!

When I made this following the recipe the yolk mixture was very dry and bitter from the dry mustard. I added a Tablespoon more of Mayo and a tabelspoon or more of sweet relish. I read another review that suggested using prepared mustard and I think that would be better.
